Detailed Description

Specifies an Array of Records.

bool vrt::ArrayOfRecords::addRecord ( const Record &  val,
int32_t  idx = -1 
)

Adds Record(s) to the Array of Records.

Parameters:
val The Array of Records to add.
idx The index to insert the new Records.
Returns:
True if successfully inserted Record; False otherwise.
int32_t vrt::ArrayOfRecords::addRecords ( const vector< Record > &  val,
int32_t  idx = -1 
)

Adds Record(s) to the Array of Records.

All Records must be the same size. Function returns upon encountering a Record of differing size.

Parameters:
val The Array of Records to add.
idx The index to insert the new Records. Records are added to the end for invalid indices.
Returns:
The number of Records inserted. Number may be less than total attempted if a Record of different size is encountered.

virtual string vrt::ArrayOfRecords::getFieldName ( int32_t  id  )  const [virtual]

Gets the name of the given field.

In 90% of cases the field name will be identical to the name used in the applicable get/set function except without the get/set prefix (e.g. "SourceContext" for "getSourceContext"). It is possible to access the names of all fields via the following: 

    for (int32_t id = 0; id < getFieldCount(); id++) {
      // id is the field ID
      getFieldName(id);
    }

In situations where it is desirable to access all available fields, it is faster to use the field ID as this eliminates any string comparisons.

Parameters:
id The field ID (on range [0,getFieldCount())).
Returns:
The field name.
Exceptions:
VRTException if the field id is invalid.

Reimplemented from vrt::Record.

virtual ValueType vrt::ArrayOfRecords::getFieldType ( int32_t  id  )  const [virtual]

Gets the type associated with a given field.

Parameters:
id The field ID (on range [0,getFieldCount())).
Returns:
The field type (n > 0) or -N if the field is a vector of values where N is the component type of the vector.

Reimplemented from vrt::Record.

vector<Record> vrt::ArrayOfRecords::getRecords ( int32_t  idx = 0,
int32_t  num = -1 
) const

Gets a copy of the Array of Records.

Parameters:
idx Index of first record to get. Invalid indicies result in empty vector returned.
num Number of records to get. Invalid number (i.e. negative or too high) result in max available from index specified.
Returns:
A copy of the Array of Records (returns an arry of length 0 if there are no entries).

void vrt::ArrayOfRecords::setApplicationSpecificHeader ( const char *  val,
size_t  bytes 
)

Sets the Application-Specific Header If val pointer is null, Application-Specific Header is only resized to the number of bytes specified.

Parameters:
val The Application-Specific Header (an arry of length 0 if none).
bytes The size of Application-Specific Header in bytes.
Exceptions:
VRTException if size of Application-Specific header exceeds 255 32-bit words
VRTException if size of Application-Specific header is negative
